$camera->model().description: Returns the name of the camera model

$camera->toArray().description: Returns the make and model as associative array.

$content->data().description: Returns the entire data array with all field objects

$content([$lang])->exists().description: Checks if the content file exists

$content([$lang])->fields().description: Returns an array with all field names

$content([$lang])->get($key, $arguments.description: Gets a field from the content

$content->language().description: Return the language code for the content

$content->name().description: Returns the name of the content file without the extension. This is being used to determine the template for the page

$content([$lang])->raw().description: Returns the raw content from the file

$content([$lang])->root().description: Returns the root for the content file

$content([$lang])->toArray().description: Returns the content object as array

$dimension->fit().description: Fits the width and height into a box by the given value and returns a modified dimension object

$dimension->fitHeight().description: Fits the height by the given value and returns a modified dimension object

$dimension->fitWidth().description: Fits the width by the given value and returns a modified dimension object

$dimension->fitWidthAndHeight().description: Fits the width and height by the given values and returns a modified dimension object

$dimension->orientation().description: Returns the orientation of the image as string (landscape|portrait|square)

$dimension->square().description: Checks if the dimensions are square

$exif->aperture().description: Returns the aperture value of the image, if it is available in the exif data set.

$exif->camera().description: Returns the $camera object for the image, which contains the make and model.

$exif->data().description: Returns the full exif data set as a raw array.

$exif->exposure().description: Returns the exposure value of the image, if it is available in the exif data set.

$exif->focalLength().description: Returns the focal length of the image, if it is available in the exif data set.

$exif->isBW().description: Checks if the image colorspace is grayscale

$exif->isColor().description: Checks if the image colorspace is either RGB or CMYK

$exif->iso().description: Returns the iso value of the image, if it is available in the exif data set.

$exif->location().description: Returns the $location object for the image if the image has GPS data.

$exif->timestamp().description: Returns the unix timestamp of when the image was taken.

$exif->toArray().description: Returns an associative array of all available exif data.

$field->bool().description: Converts the field value into a proper boolean

$field->empty().description: Checks if the field is empty

$field->escape().description: Escapes all critical characters from the field content to make sure all you get is clean HTML

$field->float().description: Converts the field value into a proper float

$field->html().description: Converts the field content to valid HTML

$field->int().description: Converts the field value into a proper integer

$field->isEmpty().description: Checks if the field is empty

$field->isFalse().description: Converts the field value into a proper boolean and inverts it

$field->isNotEmpty().description: Checks if the field is not empty

$field->isTranslated($lang = null).description: Checks if the field is translated in the current/specified language

$field->isTrue().description: Converts the field value into a proper boolean

$field->key().description: Returns the name of the field.

$field->kirbytext().description: Converts the field content from Markdown/Kirbytext to valid HTML

$field->kt().description: Converts the field content from Markdown/Kirbytext to valid HTML

$field->length().description: Returns the length of the field content

$field->link().description: Creates a link for any field value

$field->lower().description: Converts the field content to lowercase

$field->or($alternative).description: Checks if the field is empty and returns an alternative value in this case

$field->pages().description: Converts a yaml list of page URIs to valid page objects

$field->short($chars).description: Shortens the field content by the given length

$field->split($separator = ',').description: Splits the field content into an array

$field->toFile().description: Returns a file object from a filename in the field

$field->toPage().description: Returns a page object from a uri in the field

$field->toStructure().description: Converts a yaml field to a Structure object

$field->toURL().description: Creates an URL for any field value

$field->upper().description: Converts the field content to uppercase

$field->value().description: Returns the value of a field as string.

$field->widont().description: Avoids typographical widows in strings by replacing the last space with

$field->words().description: Returns the number of words in the text

$field->xml().description: Converts the field content to valid XML

$field->yaml().description: Converts YAML-structured field content to an array

$file->append($content).description: Appends the content and saves the file

$file->base64().description: Returns the content of the file as base64 encoded string

$file->blur().description: Applies a blur filter to the image

$file->content($content = null, $format.description: Setter and getter for the file content

$file->copy($to).description: Copies the file to a new location

$file->createNewFilename($name, $safeNam.description: Generates a new filename for a given name and makes sure to handle badly given extensions correctly

$file->crop($width, $height = null, $qua.description: Crops the image by width and optionally by height

$file->dataUri().description: Returns a full base64 encoded data uri with a proper mime type

$file->date($format = null, $field = 'da.description: Returns a unix timestamp or formatted date string from the file's meta date field or any other field containing a parsable date

$file->delete().description: Deletes the file. This cannot be undone.

$file->dimensions().description: Returns the $dimensions object for the file. This is only available for images (jpg, png, gif)

$file->dir().description: Returns the full path for the directory, in which the file is located

$file->diruri().description: Returns the relative path for the file

$file->download($filename = null).description: Sends all needed headers and the content to force the browser to download the file

$file->exif().description: Returns the $exif object for the file, which can be used to fetch information such as the camera model or GPS data

$file->filename().description: Returns the full filename including extension

$file->files().description: Returns the collection of sibling files including the current object

$file->hasNext().description: Checks if there's a next sibling

$file->hasPrev().description: Checks if there's a previous sibling

$file->hash().description: Returns an md5 hash for the root of the file

$file->header($send = true).description: Sends an appropriate header for the asset

$file->height().description: Returns the height of image files in pixels

$file->html($attr = array()).description: Auto-generates an HTML tag for images

$file->is($value).description: Checks if a file is of a certain type

$file->isExecutable().description: Checks if the file is executable

$file->isLandscape().description: Checks if an image file has been taken in landscape mode

$file->isPortrait().description: Checks if an image file has been taken in portrait mode

$file->isReadable().description: Checks if the file is readable

$file->isSquare().description: Checks if the image is square

$file->isWebsafe().description: Checks if the file is a jpg, png or gif

$file->isWritable().description: Checks if the file is writable

$file->load($data = array()).description: Safely requires a file if it exists

$file->meta([$language]).description: Returns the file's $content object with data from the meta file

$file->modified($format = false, $handle.description: Returns the unix timestamp or a formatted date for when the file has been modified

$file->move($to).description: Moves the file to a new location

$file->name().description: Returns the name of the file without extension

$file->niceSize().description: Returns the size of the file in a human readable format

$file->orientation().description: Returns the orientation of image files as a string (landscape, portrait, square)

$file->original().description: Returns the reference to the original file (for thumbnails)

$file->page().description: Returns the page object for a file

$file->ratio().description: Returns the ratio of an image file

$file->read($format = null).description: Reads the content of the file and returns it

$file->rename($name, $safeName = true).description: Renames the file and all the meta text files

$file->reset().description: Resets the internal memory data cache

$file->resize($width, $height = null, $q.description: Resizes the image by width and optionally by height

$file->root().description: Returns the full root for a file

$file->safeName().description: Returns the filename as safe name

$file->save($content = null, $format = n.description: Saves new content to the file

$file->scale($by).description: Scales the image up or down by value

$file->show().description: Read and send the file with the correct headers

$file->siblings().description: Returns all siblings of the file

$file->textfile([$language]).description: Returns the root for the meta file of the file

$file->thumb($params).description: Sets all parameters for the thumb generator at once.

$file->toArray($callback = null).description: Converts the entire file object into a plain PHP array

$file->toJson($callback = null).description: Converts the entire media object into a JSON string

$file->touch().description: Change the file's modification date to now and create it with an empty content if it is not there yet

$file->type().description: Returns the file type (image, document, video, archive, code, audio, unkown)

$file->update($data = array()[, $languag.description: Updates the meta information for a file

$file->uri().description: Returns the cleaned up relative path for the file

$file->url().description: Returns the absolute URL for a file

$file->width().description: Returns the width of image files in pixels

$files->count().description: Returns the number of files in the collection

$files->filter($callback).description: Applies a filter callback to each item in the collection

$files->filterBy($key [, $operator], $va.description: Filters the collection by any field and value and with a set of filtering operators

$files->find().description: Finds a single file or multiple files by one or many filenames.

$files->findBy($field, $value).description: Finds a single file by key and value

$files->first().description: Returns the first file in the collection

$files->flip().description: Returns the collection in reverse order

$files->get($filename).description: Returns a single file by filename

$files->groupBy($field, $caseInsensitive.description: Groups all files in the collection by a given field.

$files->has($file).description: Checks if a $file object is included in the collection

$files->keys().description: Returns an array with all filenames in the collection.

$files->last().description: Returns the last file in the collection

$files->limit($limit).description: Returns the collection with a limited set of items

$files->map($callback).description: Applies a callback to all items in the collection.

$files->not().description: Returns the collection without a given file. The ignored file can be passed by filename or entire file object.

$files->nth($n).description: Returns the nth file in the collection.

$files->offset($offset).description: Returns the collection starting from a given offset

$files->pluck($field, $split = null, $un.description: Plucks all values for a specific field from the collection and returns those as array.

$files->shuffle().description: Returns the collection in shuffled order.

$files->slice($offset = null, $limit = n.description: Returns a sliced version of the collection starting from a given offset and an optional limited number of items.

$files->sortBy($field, $direction = 'asc.description: Sorts the files in the collection by field and direction

$files->toArray($callback = null).description: Converts the collection to a simple array.

$files->toJson().description: Converts the collection to a json string.

attr($name, $value = null).description: Creates attributes for an HTML tag

call($function, $arguments = array()).description: Calls a function with a given set of arguments

css($path, $media = null).description: Creates one or multiple CSS link tags

dump($variable, $echo = true).description: Dumps the content of any variable in a human readable way for debugging

e($condition, $a, $b = null).description: Echos one of two alternatives depending on a condition (Shortcut for ecco())

ecco($condition, $a, $b = null).description: Echos one of two alternatives depending on a condition

esc($string, $context = 'html', $strict.description: Escapes strings based on the output context

excerpt($text, $length = 140, $mode = 'c.description: Creates an excerpt of any text by a given character or word length

get($key = null, $default = null).description: Fetches a POST or GET parameter by key

gist($url, $file = null).description: Embeds a Gist from Github by URL

gravatar($email, $size = 256, $default =.description: Builds the Gravatar URL by email

h($text, $keepTags = true).description: Converts any text to valid HTML (shortcut for html())

html($text, $keepTags = true).description: Converts any text to valid HTML

image($filename = null).description: Fetches any image by filename for the current page, or by path for any other page

invalid($data, $rules, $messages = array.description: Runs a number of validators on a set of data and checks if the data is invalid

js($path, $async = false).description: Creates a script tag to load a javascript file

kirby().description: Returns the Kirby object in any situation

kirbytag($attr).description: Makes it possible to use any defined Kirbytag as standalone function

kirbytext($text, $page = null).description: Parses any text with Markdown and Kirbytext

l($key, $default = null).description: Fetches a language variable for multi-language sites

memory().description: Returns the current memory usage in a human-readable format

multiline($text).description: Converts new lines in text to html breaks.

page($uri = null).description: Fetches any page by URI or the current page when no URI is specified

r($condition, $a, $b = null).description: Returns either $a or $b by the given condition

site().description: Returns the site object in any situation

size($input).description: Returns the size of strings, numbers, files and arrays.

smartypants($text).description: Applies the SmartyPants Typographer on an HTML string

snippet($file, $data = array(), $return.description: Embeds a snippet from the snippet folder

structure($data, $page = null, $key = nu.description: Creates a Kirby structure object from a data array

textfile($uri, $template, $lang = null).description: Helper to create correct text file names for content files

thumb($image, $params = array(), $obj =.description: Creates a thumbnail for a given image object

twitter($username, $text = null, $title.description: Builds a Twitter profile link by username

url($path = '/').description: Builds an absolute URL for a given path

vimeo($url, $width = null, $height = nul.description: Embeds a Vimeo video by URL in an iframe

widont($text).description: Avoids typographical widows in strings by replacing the last space with

xml($text).description: Converts any text to valid XML

youtube($url, $width = null, $height = n.description: Embeds a Youtube video by URL in an iframe

$language->default().description: Checks if this is the default language

$language->direction().description: Returns the text direction of the language (rtl or ltr)

$language->name().description: Returns the full name of the language

$language->url().description: Returns the assigned base URL for the language

$location->toArray().description: Returns latitude and longitude as associative array

$page->archives().description: Returns a $files collection with all archive files (zip, gzip, tar) in the page's directory

$page->audio().description: Returns a $files collection with all audio files in the page's directory

$page->children().description: Returns a $pages collection with all children of the page

$page->code().description: Returns a $files collection with all code files (css, js, html, etc.) in the page's directory

$page->content()->has($field).description: Checks if the page has a certain field

$page->contentURL().description: Returns the full URL for the content folder

$page->date($format = null, $field = 'da.description: Returns a unix timestamp or formatted date string from the page's date field or any other field containing a parsable date

$page->decrement($field, $by = 1, $max =.description: Decrement a field value by one or a given value

$page->delete($force = false).description: Deletes the $page object and all its data and files. This cannot be undone!

$page->depth().description: Returns a number, which represents the nesting depth of the page

$page->dirname().description: Returns the full name of the page's directory

$page->diruri().description: Returns the full directory path of the page starting at /content

$page->document($filename = false).description: Returns a specific document $file object by filename. If no filename is given, the first available document will be returned.

$page->documents().description: Returns a $files collection with all documents in the page's directory

$page->equals($other).description: Compares the page with another $page object and checks if they are the same

$page->file($filename = false).description: Returns a specific $file object within the page's directory by filename. If no filename is given, the first file will be returned

$page->files().description: Returns a $files collection with all files in the page's directory

$page->find($uri).description: Returns the $page object of a specific subpage by URI. If multiple URIs are given, the method will return a $pages collection with all matches.

$page->grandChildren().description: Returns a $pages collection with all children of children in the page's directory

$page->hasArchives().description: Checks if there are any archive files (zip, gzip, tar) in the page's directory

$page->hasAudio().description: Checks if there are any audio files in the page's directory

$page->hasChildren().description: Checks if the page has children

$page->hasCode().description: Checks if there are any audio files in the page's directory

$page->hasDocuments().description: Checks if there are any documents (pdf, doc, xls, etc.) in the page's directory

$page->hasFiles().description: Checks if there are any files in the page's directory

$page->hasImages().description: Checks if there are image files (jpg, png, gif, etc.) in the page directory

$page->hasInvisibleChildren().description: Checks if the page has any invisible children

$page->hasNext([$sort, $direction]).description: Checks if the page has a next sibling

$page->hasNextInvisible([$sort, $directi.description: Checks if the page has a next invisible sibling

$page->hasNextVisible([$sort, $direction.description: Checks if the page has a next visible sibling

$page->hasPrev([$sort, $direction]).description: Checks if the page has a previous sibling

$page->hasPrevInvisible([$sort, $directi.description: Checks if the page has a previous invisible sibling

$page->hasPrevVisible([$sort, $direction.description: Checks if the page has a previous visible sibling

$page->hasTemplate().description: Checks if the page has its own template or if it uses the default template

$page->hasVideos().description: Checks if there are any video files in the page directory

$page->hasVisibleChildren().description: Checks if the page has any visible children

$page->hash().description: Returns a unique hash for the page, which is used by tinyurls

$page->headers().description: Sends all appropriate headers for this page. Can be configured with the headers config array, which should contain all header definitions for each template

$page->hide().description: Removes the sorting number from the page directory to switch it to invisible

$page->id().description: Returns the page id, which is the untranslated URI

$page->image($filename = false).description: Returns a specific image $file object by filename. If no filename is given, the first available image will be returned.

$page->images().description: Returns a $files collection with all image files (jpg, png, gif, etc.) in the page directory

$page->increment($field, $by = 1, $max =.description: Increment a field value by one or a given value

$page->index().description: Recursively builds a $pages collection with all children, children of children, etc.

$page->intendedTemplate().description: Returns the name of the intended template. This is the name of the content text file.

$page->intendedTemplateFile().description: Returns the path for the intended template file

$page->inventory().description: Reads the directory and returns an inventory array

$page->is($other).description: Compares the page with another $page object and checks if they are the same

$page->isActive().description: Checks if the page is the currently active page

$page->isAncestorOf($child).description: Checks if the page is a direct or indirect ancestor of the given $page object

$page->isCacheable().description: Checks if the page can be cached

$page->isChildOf($parent).description: Checks if the page is a child of the given page

$page->isDeletable().description: Checks if the page is deletable

$page->isDescendantOf($parent).description: Checks if the page is a descendant of the given page

$page->isDescendantOfActive().description: Checks if the page is a descendant of the currently active page

$page->isErrorPage().description: Checks if the page is the error page

$page->isHomePage().description: Checks if the page is the home page

$page->isInvisible().description: Checks if the page is invisible

$page->isOpen().description: Checks if the page is open. This means that it is either active or it is a direct or indirect parent of the currently active page.

$page->isParentOf($child).description: Checks if the page is the parent of the given page

$page->isSite().description: Checks if this page object is the main site

$page->isVisible().description: Checks if the page is visible

$page->isWritable().description: Checks if the page is writable

$page->modified($format = false).description: Returns the unix timestamp or a formatted date string of the last modification date of the page

$page->move($uid).description: Changes the uid for the page

$page->parents().description: Returns a $pages collection of all parents

$page->reset().description: Cleans the temporary page cache and the cache of all parent pages

$page->root().description: Returns the full root of the page directory

$page->slug([$lang = null]).description: Returns the slug. The slug is the last part of the page's URL. It is translatable in multi-language sites while the UID always stays the page's directory name without the sorting number.

$page->sort($num = null).description: Changes the sorting number of the page.

$page->template().description: Returns the name of the used template for the page. Will return default if the intended template cannot be found.

$page->templateData().description: Additional data, which will be passed to the template

$page->templateFile().description: Returns the full path of the template file.

$page->textfile($template = null [, $lan.description: Returns the root for the content file

$page->tinyurl().description: Returns the tinyurl for the page if tinyurls are activated in the config

$page->title().description: Returns the page title. The title is fetched from the content unless it does not exist. In this case it will be overwritten by the UID.

$page->toArray($callback = null).description: Converts the entire page object into a plain PHP array

$page->toJson($callback = null).description: Converts the entire page array into a json string

$page->uid().description: The UID is the page directory name without the sorting number.

$page->update($data = array() [, $lang =.description: Updates the page content with all passed variables.

$page->uri([$lang = null]).description: Returns the URI. The URI is the relative URL without the host or any subfolders.

$page->url().description: Returns the full URL of the page

$page->urlKey($lang = null).description: Returns the URL key from the content file if available and otherwise returns the page UID

$page->video($filename = false).description: Returns a specific video $file object by filename. If no filename is given, the first available video will be returned.

$page->videos().description: Returns a $files collection with all videos in the page directory.

$pages->add($page).description: Adds a single page object or a collection to a collection

$pages->append($key, $object).description: Appends an element to the data array

$pages->children().description: Returns a $pages collection with all children of each page in the collection

$pages->chunk($size).description: Creates chunks of the same size and returns them in a new collection

$pages->count().description: Returns the number of pages in the collection

$pages->current().description: Returns the current element of the array

pages::extractValue($item, $field).description: Makes sure to provide a valid value for each filter method no matter if an object or an array is given

$pages->files().description: Returns a $files collection with all files of each page in the collection

$pages->filter($callback).description: Filters the collection with a custom filter callback

$pages->filterBy($key [, $operator], $va.description: Filters the collection by any field and value and with a set of filtering operators

$pages->find($page).description: Finds a $page object in the collection by UID or relative URI

$pages->findBy($key, $value).description: Finds a single $page object in the collection by $key and $value

$pages->findByURI($uri).description: Finds a $page object in the collection by its full URI

$pages->findOpen().description: Finds the open $page object in the collection

$pages->first().description: Returns the first $page object from the collection

$pages->flip().description: Returns the collection in reverse order

$pages->get($key, $default = null).description: Returns a $page object by its full URI

$pages->group($callback).description: Groups the collection by a given callback

$pages->groupBy($field, $caseInsensitive.description: Groups $page objects in the collection by any field and returns them in a new collection

$pages->has($page).description: Checks if a $page object is included in the collection

$pages->index().description: Recursively creates a full index from all pages and subpages in the collection and returns it as a new flat $pages collection

$pages->indexOf($needle).description: Tries to find the index number for the given element

$pages->invisible().description: Returns all invisible $page objects from the collection

$pages->key().description: Returns the current key from the array

$pages->keyOf($needle).description: Tries to find the key for the given element

$pages->keys().description: Returns all keys/URIs from the collection

$pages->last().description: Returns the last $page object from the collection

$pages->limit($limit).description: Returns the collection with a limited amount of pages

$pages->map($callback).description: Returns a new collection and applies the mapping callback to all pages

$pages->next().description: Moves the cursor to the next element in the array and returns it

$pages->not($args).description: Returns the collection without any given pages.

$pages->nth($n).description: Returns the nth page in the collection

$pages->offset($offset).description: Returns the collection starting from the given offset

$pages->paginate($limit, $options = arra.description: Adds a $pagination object to the collection, which makes it easy to page through items

$pages->pluck($field, $split = null, $un.description: Extracts an array of values from each item by field

$pages->prepend($key, $object).description: Prepends an element to the data array

$pages->prev().description: Moves the cursor to the previous element in the array and returns it

$pages->rewind().description: Moves the cursor to the first element of the array

$pages->search($query, $params = array().description: Searches all pages in the collection and all descendants
